page.title: 14EMPLOYMENT IN BLACKPOOL
page.content: Practically all employment in Blackpool is geared to the holiday industry, which creates particular problems in the area when the season is over. During the season the resort is filled with people who come seeking casual employment, but during the winter the town empties, and unemployment, particularly among school leavers is high. The holiday aspect of the town creates almost two levels of society which are possibly unique to a holiday resort. There are the successful hoteliers, businessmen and the professional classes such as accountants and solicitors who look after the former, and the second group of unemployed, or lowly paid who work in the hotels and businesses.
